ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: This example shows how to use static axis in charts. This example uses a background-thread Timer with variable interval of 20 ms to demonstrate the effect.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
This example shows how to create a Static Axis - where ticks and gridlines do not move - by setting the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.Axes.IAxis~IsStaticAxis.html']AxisBase.IsStaticAxis[/url] property to true.
The X axis is made static so tick labels on axis are always at the same positions. Instead, axis label values update according to displayed data. On the chart there is also annotation collection with VerticalLineAnnotations.
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
This example looks a lot better using the new [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Drawing~SciChart.Drawing.HighQualityRasterizer.HighQualityRenderSurface.html']HighQualityRenderSurface[/url] due to its superior handling of transparency. For maximum performance use the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Enabling%20The%20Visual%20Xccelerator%20Engine.html']Visual Xccelerator Engine[/url].
